alert.note: Alert for Whatcom (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 11:04AM PST until December 06 at 1:33AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Nooksack River At North Cedarville affecting Whatcom County. .Heavy rain is mainly over now but the flood wave continues to make its way downstream and has pushed the Nooksack at North Cedarville above flood stage. For the North West Region...including Saxon Bridge, North Cedarville, Ferndale, Burlington, Concrete, Mt. Vernon, Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nooksack River at North Cedarville. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 146.5 feet, the Nooksack River will cause shallow flooding of low pasture lands along the river downstream through Lynden. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 146.5 feet. - Flood stage is 146.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM PST Tuesday was 146.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 146.6 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 715 PM PST.
